text: date: fri, 03 dec 1999 15:52:50 -0600 from: michael moore (mmoore@eagleusa.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: big goppers woo little boppersit was very interesting that the gop article did not mention the senators actually sitting down and working with the children ("big goppers woo little boppers," 2.dec.99). i seriously doubt if they are more than marginally computer literate. although i firmly and personally support computers in the classroom, one should not get that confused with politics – and these senators were all about politics.as for the article stating that "senators emphasized that the republican party was a perfect fit for the tech community, as opposed to that other party," i find this a very revealing observation! translated, what it means is that the tech community, due to the current stock market mania for tech companies, is getting very rich – and of course, those with any bit of objectivity know that the republican party is the party favoring rich - even if just based upon their "trickle down" theory!
